title: After waking from suspend, terminal has tiny font rendering
body:
This issue occurs on my laptop that's running Ubuntu 18.04 with xfce 4.12 (X11).

This is a Dell XPS 13 with a 4k screen and I'm using xfce's custom DPI scaling of 192.

I started using Alacritty recently and it works very well for me. I started using version 0.3.3 and I noticed that it would crash whenever I woke my laptop from suspend. I looked into it and saw that the error message included

    thread 'main' panicked at '[winit] Failed to find any monitors using XRandR.'

which seemed to be [this winit bug](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/705).

I tried upgrading to Alacritty 0.4.0 and it fixed the crash. However, there's a new problem: the terminal is restored with an incorrect rendering where the font is extremely small.

Here are small xfce4-terminal and alacritty windows side-by-side:

![screen_20191125120646](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/318501/69576410-1114e000-0f81-11ea-9e7e-6333d9a602d9.png)

Here are the same two windows after I close my laptop lid, reopen it, and unlock:

![screen_20191125120730](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/318501/69576422-196d1b00-0f81-11ea-9ef4-683bde906d88.png)

## More info

I'm not sure what logs will be the most useful. First, here's the the output from running `alacritty -vvv`. I started alacritty (these are the logs from 12:25) and then a couple of minutes later I suspended my laptop and woke it up (these are the logs from 12:27).
